oai_dc:dc.dc:title: History of command form for Company K, 5th Regiment, Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Stokes, William B., 1814-1897
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Form No. 47 explaining the history of the command of Company K, 5th Regiment of the Tennessee Volunteer Cavalry, from March 1, 1863, to March 31, 1865. The company was commanded by Captain E. W. Bass, who was dismissed from service December 31, 1864. He was succeeded by First Lieutenant Wingate T. Robinson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- War Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 5th Tennesee Volunteer Cavalry of the U. S. Army was mustered at Murfreesboro, Nashville, and Carthage for a three-year service term by Colonel William Brickly Stokes and was posted at Nashville. They participated in numerous engagements in Middle Tennessee, including the Battle of Stones River and the Siege of Murfreesboro.
